RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia de Computao pela Universidade do Estado de Minas Gerais - UEMG (2005), mestrado em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA (2010), doutorado em Engenharia Aeronutica e Mecnica - Sistemas Aeroespaciais e Mecatrnica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica - ITA (2018), atuando principalmente nos seguintes temas: desenvolvimento e gerenciamento de projetos; Sistemas Computacionais Embarcados; Mtodos geis; gesto de times distribudos; desenvolvimento de sistemas autnomos e automticos, uso de IA e redes neurais, projetos visando aumentar o nvel de automao (LoA) para aviao comercial, executiva e de defesa (part 23 e 25).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: bachelor's at Engenharia de Computao from Universidade do Estado de Minas Gerais (2005) and master's at Aerospace Engineering from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (2010). , acting on the following subjects: development software/hardware in C/C++ and Assumbly, uml 2.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: MTODOS GEIS PARA O DESENVOLVIMENTO DE SISTEMAS COMPUTACIONAIS EMBARCADOS CRTICOS POR TIMES DISTRIBUDOS
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Esta tese tem como objetivo propor um conjunto de prticas complementares aos mtodos geis visando adequ-los ao desenvolvimento de sistemas embarcados por times distribudos. Para viabilizar este objetivo foram propostos dois mtodos de identificao de lacunas. O primeiro teve como objetivo identificar lacunas referentes ao uso de mtodos geis para o desenvolvimento de sistemas embarcados crticos, enquanto o segundo analisou a influncia dos mtodos geis no desenvolvimento por times distribudos. Foram ento propostas prticas complementares para atender as lacunas identificadas. Para avaliao das lacunas identificadas e das prticas propostas foram desenvolvidos dois casos de aplicao em ambiente acadmico. O primeiro caso de aplicao emulou o desenvolvimento de sistemas embarcados crticos por times distribudos sem a utilizao das prticas complementares propostas. Este caso de aplicao confirmou a maioria das lacunas identificadas. O segundo caso de aplicao repetiu as condies de execuo do primeiro, mas agora com a insero das prticas complementares propostas. Como resultado observou-se uma melhora significativa nos problemas associados s lacunas identificadas.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This thesis has the objective to propose a set of complementary practices to agile methods aiming to adapt them to the development of embedded systems by distributed teams. In order to achieve that objective, two methods of gaps identification have been proposed. The first one had the objective to identify gaps regarding the use of agile methods for the development of critical embedded systems, the second analyzed the influence of agile methods over the development done by distributed teams. Hence, supplementary practices were proposed to address the identified gaps. Two application cases in the academic environment were developed to assess the identified gaps and the proposed practices. The first case emulated the development of critical embedded systems by distributed teams without the use of the proposed complementary practices. The application case confirmed most of the gaps identified. The second case used the proposed complementary practices with the same execution conditions of the first case. As a result, there was a significant improvement in the problems associated with the identified gaps.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Agile Methods for Developing Critical Embedded Computing Systems by Distributed Teams

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: PROCESSO DE INDUO DE FRATURA CONTROLADA EM DIAFRAGMAS DE TNEIS DE VENTO HIPERSNICOS UTILIZANDO UM LASER A FIBRA
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Pesquisa e desenvolvimento no processo de usinagem de micro ranhuras com laser a fibra para induzir fraturas em diafragmas metlicos utilizados no controle de escoamento de gs de tneis de vento hipersnicos
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: The rupture pressure of hypersonic wind-tunnel, as the developed ones in the IEAv, is controlled normally using metallic diaphragms, in whose surface they are engraving micro-grooves that have for directional function and to facilitate the breaking process. The manufacture of the micro-grooves for the used conventional method until the gift is gotten by mechanics engraving and has as main problem, the difficulty to reproduce the dimensions of the micro-grooves due to the wear of the cut tools.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Using an Pulsed Ytterbium Fiber Laser in Process Diaphragm Fabrication of Hypersonic Wind-Tunnel

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Capacitao em Sistemas Autnomos - Taxiamento Autnomo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Gerente e integrador do projeto engajando da ordem de 150 pessoas da Embraer e 10 pessoas da UFES. Este projeto foi desenvolvido em cooperao cientfica e tecnolgica entre a Ufes e a Embraer, nas reas de robtica autnoma e de inteligncia artificial, resultou no primeiro teste de uma aeronave autnoma no Brasil. A iniciativa bem-sucedida possibilitou que um prottipo realizasse sozinho a operao de taxiamento, movimentando-se em solo por um trajeto previamente estabelecido e sem interferncia humana.
O conjunto de navegao por sensores e imagem conduziu a aeronave demonstradora da tecnologia de sistemas autnomos pela pista de decolagem, pela rea de txi e pelo ptio de forma totalmente independente, sem auxlio externo. Um piloto acompanhou a operao da cabine de comando, caso houvesse alguma intercorrncia. O teste ocorreu na ltima semana de agosto, na Unidade da Embraer em Gavio Peixoto, interior de So Paulo.

Gerente do projeto denominado Roadmap Tecnolgico para Sistemas Autnomos, projeto com o objetivo de desenvolver um Roadmap tecnolgico visando operao Single Pilot e No Piloto para as aviao Comerciais, Executiva e Defesa. Palavra Chave: Autonomia, Automao, OODA, Level of automation (LoA), STPA, Stamp, CONOPS, Desconstruo do piloto, tarefas dos pilotos.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Desenvolvimento de um FBW-SCE para aviao comercial

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Developing a CDS with Scrum in an interdisciplinary academic project
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Developing a CDS with Scrum in an interdisciplinary academic project

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2014 IEEE/AIAA 33rd Digital Avionics Systems Conference (DASC)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: uring the 2nd semester of 2013, at the Brazilian Aeronautics Institute of Technology (Instituto Tecnologico de Aeronautica - ITA), a successful Interdisciplinary Problem Based Learning (IPBL) experience took place. At that time, almost 70 undergraduate and graduate students from 4 different courses within just 17 academic weeks had the opportunity of conceptualizing, modeling, and developing an Avionics Real-Time Embedded System (ARTES) with Cockpit Display Systems (CDS) for a fictitious Unmanned Aircraft Vehicle (UAV). This intensive and collaborative academic project has used the Scrum agile method and its best practices, and the Safety-Critical Application Development Environment (SCADE) from Esterel Technologies. This experience was stored in a Google site and implemented as a Proof of Concept (PoC). It represents just one example of how to solve the old problem of teaching and learning complex real-time avionics embedded systems, by collaboratively using the Scrum agile method with SCADE, a state of the art integrated CASE tool environment. Its main results are reported in this paper.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Hardware-software allocation specification of IMA systems for early simulation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Hardware-software allocation specification of IMA systems for early simulation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2014 IEEE/AIAA 33rd Digital Avionics Systems Conference (DASC)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Model-driven engineering (MDE) is becoming a key approach in systems engineering, including Integrated Modular Avionics (IMA) design. It relies on systematic use of models from an early phase of the design process to provide source code generation, validation and analysis support. However, due to the complexity of IMA systems - that may incorporate hundreds of avionics functions and dozens of execution nodes - even early stage model-based analysis of their design can become cumbersome. This is especially true for safety related nonfunctional requirements like communication channel redundancy or error propagation and contamination. In this paper, we present a model-driven framework to support the iterative design and analysis of IMA systems using an integrated Simulink model for analyzing the complete HW-SW architecture of the system.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Applying Interdisciplinarity and Agile Methods in the Development of a Smart Grids System
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Applying Interdisciplinarity and Agile Methods in the Development of a Smart Grids System

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 2013 Tenth International Conference on Information Technology: New Generations (ITNG)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: 2013 10th International Conference on Information Technology: New Generations

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper describes an experiment of integrating undergraduate and graduate courses at the Brazilian Aeronautics Institute of Technology, within the Computer Engineering Undergraduate Program and the Electronic and Computing Engineering Graduate Program, during the 2nd semester of 2011. A Smart Grids System case study was used as a Problem Based Learning strategy together with agile best practices within a project development. This experiment has involved four courses: Embedded Systems (undergraduate), Embedded and Real-Time Systems, Software Quality, Reliability, and Safety, and Advanced Topics in Software Testing. During this experiment, the students of all these courses had to interact and collaborate in order to produce a prototype of a Smart Grids System, simulating a real project development.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Developing an ARINC 661 Cockpit Display System Server with the SCADE Solutions for ARINC 661 Compliant Systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Developing an ARINC 661 Cockpit Display System Server with the SCADE Solutions for ARINC 661 Compliant Systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: SAE 2012 Aerospace Electronics and Avionics Systems Conference

PALAVRAS-CHAVE.PALAVRA-CHAVE-2: Software Aeronutico Embarcado, Crtico e de Tempo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: mbraer began development of an ARINC 661-compliant cockpit display system with Esterel Technologies SCADE Solutions for ARINC 661 Applications. Over the past two years, Embraer has been able to build a fully-functional ARINC 661 demonstrator that includes all components necessary for CDS deployment under the ARINC 661 standard. The ARINC 661 demonstrator includes a fully-compliant ARINC 661 server based originally on Esterel Technologies SCADE 661 Server Creator using an automatic server generator. Embraer had successfully integrated a custom ARINC 661-4, widgets library, with Esterel Technologies widget library, designed with SCADE as the base. Embraer has also developed and integrated User Applications running on a IMA hardware system and communicating with the server using UDP over AFDX within a flight simulator system. This paper discuss the process followed by Embraer for development of the ARINC 661 demonstrator.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Developing an ARINC 661 Cockpit Display System Server with the SCADE Solutions for ARINC 661 Compliant Systems
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Developing an ARINC 661 Cockpit Display System Server with the SCADE Solutions for ARINC 661 Compliant Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: mbraer began development of an ARINC 661-compliant cockpit display system with Esterel Technologies SCADE Solutions for ARINC 661 Applications. Over the past two years, Embraer has been able to build a fully-functional ARINC 661 demonstrator that includes all components necessary for CDS deployment under the ARINC 661 standard. The ARINC 661 demonstrator includes a fully-compliant ARINC 661 server based originally on Esterel Technologies SCADE 661 Server Creator using an automatic server generator. Embraer had successfully integrated a custom ARINC 661-4, widgets library, with Esterel Technologies widget library, designed with SCADE as the base. Embraer has also developed and integrated User Applications running on a IMA hardware system and communicating with the server using UDP over AFDX within a flight simulator system. This paper discuss the process followed by Embraer for development of the ARINC 661 demonstrator.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Applying agile methods to aircraft embedded software: an experimental analysis
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Applying agile methods to aircraft embedded software: an experimental analysis

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper discusses the applicability of agile methods to aircraft embedded software development. It presents the main results of an experiment that combines agile practices from Scrum with model‐based development and distributed development. The experiment consists of the development of an aircraft cockpit display system divided in five distributed teams. Three features are analysed and quantified, using the output artefacts of each team: the artefacts' quality, the adherence to agile methods, and the adherence to standard DO‐178C. The main conclusion of the experiment is that there is a high correlation between the adherence to agile methods and the artefacts' quality, motivating the use of agile methods in aircraft industry. Also, the experiment evinced that agile methods does not specifically address the integration of distributed teams and the hardware/software integration. This lacuna affects the artefacts' quality. The results of the experiment emphasize the importance of concentrating future work in the proposal of specific agile practices for these activities. Copyright 2017 John Wiley & Sons, Ltd.
